Description: Terracotta tortoise figure. Mould-made shell with handmade legs. Fine buff clay.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Parallels made and found in Rhodes dated to the early 5th century BC in very similar forms (Higgins 1970, nos 191-197). A parallel from Cyprus dated 5th century BC was possibly made in an imported Greek mould, thus explaining the similarity between Rhodian and Cypriot production (Kargeorghis 1996, 48, fig.38 Cyprus Museum D166). Parallels from Kamiros, Rhodes (Jacopi 1930, 289, fig. 319). Jacopi, G. 1930. Esplorazione archeologica di Camiro I. Clara Rhodos IV. Scavi Nelle Necropoli Camiresi 1929-1930. Karageorghis, V. 1996. The coroplastic art of ancient Cyprus. VI. The Cypro-Archaic Period monsters, animals and miscellanea. Nicosia, University of Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.088) (Phase 3)
